title-group.article-title: Validating FAA Structural Loads Regulations Using Operational Data

permissions.copyright-statement: Copyright 2000 Society of Automotive Engineers, Inc.

abstract.p: Mr. Barnes is the Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) Chief Scientific and Technical Advisor for Structural Loads and Design Criteria, and in this position he is responsible for recommending appropriate research to support his discipline. He recommended the establishment of the FAA Operational Loads Monitoring Program in 1988, (Reference 1) and continues to actively promote and monitor the research, and use of the results.

ref.mixed-citation: Barnes, T. and DeFiore T., 'The New FAA Flight Loads Monitoring Program," AIAA 91-0258, 1991.
"Flight Loads Data for a Boeing 737-400 in Commer- cial Operation," DOT/FAA/AR-95/21.
"Flight Loads Data for a Boeing 737-400 in Commer- cial Operations," Department of Transportation Report DOT/FAA/AR-98/28, August 1998.
"Statistical Loads Data for MD-82/-83 Aircraft in Commercial Operations," Department of Transporta- tion Report DOT/FAA/AR-98/65, November 1998.
"Methods for Experimentally Determining Commer- cial Jet Aircraft Landing Parameters from Video Image Data," Department of Transportation Report DOT/FAA/CT-93/7, August 1993.
"Video Landing Parameter Survey-John F. Kennedy International Airport," Department of Transportation Report DOT/FAA/AR 96/125.
"Video Landing Parameter Survey -Washington National Airport," Department of transportation Report DOT/FAA/AR-97/106, June 1999.
